page.title: 05St. Lukes'Belfry.
page.content: Mr. Partington is the lead bellringer at {St. Lukes'Church.}In the church there are eight {bells.}The largest bell is the tenor, it weighs just over one ton, and its width is 1.25m.The longest clapper is one metre long. The bells were recast in 1921 by Gillet and Johnston of London, when one of the bells cracked. The bells are made of four parts copper and one part tin. They had to lower the bells because it was too hard to ring them when they were high up. The clock only has three faces because the fourth side is the church. The clock is run by electricity. The tower itself is 202 feet high. The first chapel was built in 1552 and stood for 290 years, then a new one was built. When Heywood was a small village, St. Lukes was the main church.
